p: We observed that plants with high RFC values depict their dominancy in the study area and indigenous people are more familiar with them. They prefer these plants over others because of their availability and positive role in traditional health system. These results are in line with the appearance hypothesis which explains that local people have greater knowledge of ethnomedicinal use on plants which are more common in an area [ 58]. Additionally, common plants would allow local people to gain more experience of their properties and consequently would have a greater probability of being introduced into the local culture [ 56].
